definition: absolutely ridiculous (idiom); preposterous/the height of folly

sentences.english: Holidays are often absurdly generous, but the real issue is pensions.
sentences.chinese: 假期经常充足到荒谬，但真正的问题在于养老金。

sentences.english: In addition, he turned the justice anti-invasion war into absurdly indiscriminate rejection of everything foreign.
sentences.chinese: 把正义的反侵略的爱国主义变成了荒谬的盲目排外。

sentences.english: It's always irrational as well, in addition.
The policy was followed to an absurd extreme.
sentences.chinese: 这项政策被执行到了极端荒谬的程度。

sentences.english: If you examine the messages, you will see the absurdity.
sentences.chinese: 如果你检查邮件，你将看到很荒谬的事。

sentences.english: Man, I am getting to sound as absurd as Zhang Jiehai himself.
sentences.chinese: 老兄啊，我听起来就快要和张结海一样荒谬了。

sentences.english: He rushed about doing preposterous things in an extraordinary manner.
sentences.chinese: 他奔来奔去，离奇古怪地干下了种种荒谬的事情。

sentences.english: Well, one, it just starts to look ridiculous, frankly.
sentences.chinese: 第一，坦白的说，这开始看起来很荒谬。

sentences.english: Happiness and the absurd are two sons of the same earth.
sentences.chinese: 幸福与荒谬是同一块土地的双生子。

sentences.english: But many Western concerns are absurd.
sentences.chinese: 但西方的很多忧虑是荒谬的。

sentences.english: I realize that seems a preposterous claim.
sentences.chinese: 我知道这个断言有点荒谬。

sentences.english: Everything that exalts life at the same time increases its absurdity.
sentences.chinese: 每件称颂生命的事物同时也增加了生命的荒谬。

sentences.english: I put my request in an absurd, almost insolent form.
sentences.chinese: 我把我的请求用荒谬的甚至无礼的形式说出来了。

sentences.english: It’s not as ridiculous as it sounds.
sentences.chinese: 这么做其实并不像它听起来那么荒谬。

sentences.english: Belief in the absurdity of existence must then dictate his conduct.
sentences.chinese: 如果他相信存在是荒谬的，那么他必定有所行动。

definition: absolutely ridiculous (idiom); preposterous/the height of folly
to imagine the wildest thing/to indulge in fantasy
to sensationalize (idiom); deliberate exaggeration to scare people
